revealed_symptoms.pruritus: It’s super itchy sometimes, or feels kind of tingly, like a weird sensation under my skin.
revealed_symptoms.color variation: It’s got a bunch of different colors—like brown, black, maybe even some red or blue mixed in.

hidden_symptoms.diameter >6mm: It’s bigger than the eraser on a pencil, and I feel like it’s still growing.
hidden_symptoms.ulceration: It’s like a cut or sore that just won’t heal, and sometimes it scabs over but comes right back.
hidden_symptoms.hyperkeratosis: There's this rough, flaky spot that won’t go away, and sometimes it peels.
hidden_symptoms.nodule formation: It’s kind of thick or raised, not flat like some of my other moles.
hidden_symptoms.rapid growth: I swear this mole or bump got bigger really fast, like in just a few weeks.
hidden_symptoms.evolving: This thing keeps changing—getting darker, bigger, or just looking different than before.
hidden_symptoms.asymmetry: One side of this mole looks different from the other, like it's lopsided or uneven.
hidden_symptoms.border irregularity: The edges are all jagged, kinda messy, not smooth like my other moles.
hidden_symptoms.spontaneous bleeding: Sometimes this spot just starts bleeding out of nowhere, even if I don’t touch it.
hidden_symptoms.shiny or waxy bump: It looks kinda like a smooth, shiny pimple, but it never pops or goes away.

patient_history.content: Hi, I'll be your doctor today. What brings you in?

Well, I've got this spot that's been super itchy sometimes, or feels kind of tingly, like a weird sensation under my skin. And it’s got a bunch of different colors—like brown, black, maybe even some red or blue mixed in.

Thank you for the information. Based on what you've described, I'd like to ask you a couple more questions about this spot. Has this spot changed in size or shape recently? Also, has there been any bleeding or crusting associated with it?
Yeah, I feel like it's gotten bigger recently. And sometimes it just starts bleeding out of nowhere, even if I don’t touch it. There's also been some crusting, like a scab that comes and goes.

Thank you. Given that the spot has changed in size, bleeds, and has crusting, I'm concerned about the possibility of skin cancer, specifically melanoma.  Do you have a history of significant sun exposure? Also, is there any family history of skin cancer?
No, I don’t think I’ve had more sun than anyone else. And nobody in my family has had skin cancer that I know of.
Thank you. To help understand this further, where on your body is this spot located? Also, are there any other spots on your body that look similar to this one?
It’s on my back. And no, there aren't any other spots like it.
Thank you. Considering the location and the characteristics you described, can you tell me how quickly the spot seems to have grown? Also, is the spot painful or tender to the touch?
I swear this spot got bigger really fast, like in just a few weeks. And no, it doesn’t hurt or feel tender.

doctor_history.content: Well, I've got this spot that's been super itchy sometimes, or feels kind of tingly, like a weird sensation under my skin. And it’s got a bunch of different colors—like brown, black, maybe even some red or blue mixed in.
